text: A number of units of measurement have been used in Tanzania to measure length, mass, capacity, etc. The metric system was adopted in Tanzania from 1967 to 1969. ==System before metric system== A number of units were used. ===Zanzibar=== Several units were used in Zanzibar ====Length==== One ohra was equal to 0.571 m (22.48 in). ====Weight==== One bazla was equal to 15.525 kg (32.226 lb). One mane was equal to 2.0071 lb. One franzella of 36 rotoli was equal to 35.2822 lb. ====Capacity==== One djezla was equal to 257.4 l (7.305 bushels). ==References== Category:Tanzanian culture Tanzania
title: Tanzanian units of measurement
